Mentored by Vikram Rathour and coaches at the Rajasthan Royals' academy, the wicketkeeper-batter has impressed with Saha-like glovework and Dravid-like patience.

title: Best October air since 2022 as rain lashes Delhi again
By reusing old genes, bats became the only mammals able to fly
description: Scientists have long wondered how bats keep a sheet of skin between their fingers. In other mammals, this sheet disappears before birth in a process where the cells die on purpose, called apoptosis. One leading hypothesis is that bats evolved flight by suppressing this interdigital cell death

title: The tale of Partition Committee that discussed  bifurcation of Andhra State from Madras in 1949
description: The panel’s work remains less known. Had the committee succeeded in its mission, the history of south India would have been different.

title: Fat-loss drug Mounjaro now India's No. 2 pharma brand
description: Eli Lilly's weight-loss drug Mounjaro is rapidly climbing the ranks in the Indian pharmaceutical market, nearing GlaxoSmithKline's antibiotic Augmentin in monthly sales. Launched in March, Mounjaro generated Rs 80 crore in September, becoming the second-largest brand. Its high unit value contributes significantly to its impressive revenue despite lower volumes.

title: Ecuador detains 5 people after alleged assassination attempt on President Noboa
Delhi: Water crisis at Vasant Kunj’s upscale shopping centres as police stop pvt tankers
Cough syrup tragedy: Toll hits 17; doctors say toxic chemical affecting brain
description: Two more children have died from toxic cough syrup Coldrif in Madhya Pradesh, bringing the total to 17 in 43 days. Both victims suffered renal failure and severe brain damage due to diethylene glycol, found at nearly 500% above permissible limits. Officials are conducting a door-to-door survey to retrieve remaining bottles of the banned syrup.

description: India U19 batter Vaibhav Suryavanshi was controversially given out for 20 in the second Youth Test against Australia U19. The 14-year-old prodigy, who previously scored a century, protested the umpire's decision. Earlier, India's bowling attack, led by Henil and Khilan Patel, dismissed Australia for 135, giving India a slight first-innings lead.

Following a dismissal, alleged sledging led to a confrontation, though Maharashtra's captain downplayed the incident as a practice match occurrence.

Despite this bittersweet moment, Knies remains focused on the Maple Leafs' long-term success, signing a team-friendly deal and prioritizing team goals for the upcoming season.

description: Bombay High Court upheld SBI's decision to declare Reliance Communications' loan account as fraud, holding promoters like Anil Ambani liable for company actions. The court dismissed Ambani's challenge, stating promoters in control are automatically subject to penal measures and debarred from raising funds.  Ambani's petition was deemed to have no merit.

IPS officer 'shoots self' at home with gunman's revolver; leaves 9-page note
description: Haryana ADGP Y Puran Kumar, known for flagging irregularities and alleged caste bias within his department, was found dead from a gunshot wound at his Chandigarh residence. He had reportedly left a nine-page "final note" and a will before taking his gunman's service revolver in the soundproofed basement of his brother-in-law's house.

'Spoke with my friend': PM Modi calls Putin to wish him on his birthday
description: Prime Minister Modi and President Putin spoke ahead of their annual summit, reaffirming a strong India-Russia strategic partnership. Modi extended birthday wishes to Putin, expressing appreciation for his dedication to bilateral ties. The Russian President is expected in India on December 6 for their 23rd summit, marking his first visit since the Ukraine conflict began.

BJP has finished Nitish Kumar physically and mentally: Pappu Yadav
description: Rajesh Ranjan alias Pappu Yadav, six-times Bihar MP is currently an Independent MP from Purnea in Seemanchal (border) area. Having a bahubali (strongman) image, he also does lot of charity donating money to the needy people. Though it is an Assembly election in Bihar, he has been in the limelight for many reasons. Recently Mr. Yadav was seen sharing dais with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and was also caught on camera when he was not allowed to share the open vehicle in which Rahul Gandhi and Tejashwi Yadav were moving in Patna. The Hindu caught him at his residence in Patna in which he spoke on several issues including giving advice to Tejashwi Yadav and Chirag Paswan to destroy the arrogance. He also asserted that he does not mind even though he was humiliated. Excerpts.

title: NDA will win Ghatshila by-poll, claims Babulal Marandi

Himachal tragedy: 18 dead as landslide strikes bus in Bilaspur; many missing
description: A devastating landslide in Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur district crushed a private bus, killing at least 18 passengers and leaving many missing. Local residents bravely initiated rescue efforts before authorities arrived, with four survivors, including three children, pulled from the debris. Heavy rainfall is believed to have triggered the tragic incident.

title: Bihar polls: 1,200 CAPF companies likely to be deployed
Ukraine claims capturing Indian national fighting for Russian army - what we know
description: Ukrainian forces have reportedly captured a 22-year-old Indian national fighting for the Russian army. Indian authorities are verifying the reports. The man, identified as Majoti Sahil Mohammed from Gujarat, allegedly joined the Russian military after a drug conviction. He claims he did not want to fight and surrendered. He was reportedly promised freedom and payment but received none.

title: J&K L-G gets angry at drop of hat, thinned my security cover for raising serious questions: Deputy Chief Minister Surinder Choudhary

title: Delhi Confidential: Mixed flavours
PM Modi goes past yet another milestone; vows to work harder
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi marked his 25th year in constitutional office, vowing to work harder for a 'Viksit Bharat'. Reflecting on his tenures as Gujarat CM and Prime Minister, he highlighted overcoming challenges and empowering citizens, particularly Nari Shakti, Yuva Shakti, and Annadatas. Modi recalled his mother's advice to always work for the poor and remain incorruptible.

title: 'Demonises Muslims': SC to examine if BJP video attracts hate speech FIR
description: The Supreme Court has agreed to examine a plea seeking an FIR against Assam BJP for a video alleging Muslims would take over the state. Petitioners argue the video vilifies Muslims and violates the apex court's order against hate speech. The court issued notice and will hear the case on October 28.

title: World Junior Championships: India beat SL for second win
description: India, the second seeds and firm favourites to top Group H, lived up to expectations with a 45-27, 45-21 victory over Sri Lanka, who had edged the United Arab Emirates in a close tie on Monday

title: Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf’s kids: What Jaden & Jaz are up to in 2025
description: Tennis legends Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf prioritized a normal upbringing for their children, Jaden and Jaz Elle, allowing them to pursue individual passions. Jaden is now building a baseball career, while Jaz Elle enjoys a private life focused on arts and outdoor activities. Their parents offer unwavering support, fostering their dreams without pressure.

title: Taylor Swift’s strained bond with Blake Lively shifts after Travis Kelce’s move
description: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have maintained distance from Blake Lively following legal drama. Recently, Travis Kelce's podcast rereleased an episode reviewing Blake Lively's movie, 'The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants.' This has sparked fan speculation, especially with Swift's new album release, as neither star has publicly addressed their reported fallout.

title: Bihar SIR: Supreme Court asks EC to give details of 3.7 lakh excluded voters
description: The Supreme Court questioned an NGO's claims of voter list deletions in Bihar, with the Election Commission stating all parties are satisfied and no appeals were filed. Justices urged the NGO to present affidavits from individuals alleging wrongful removal, highlighting the lack of direct complaints despite a significant number of exclusions.

title: UK: British Sikh group prepares legal action over Islamophobia definition
description: A British Sikh organisation is threatening legal action against the UK government over a potential new definition of Islamophobia. The Network of Sikh Organisations (NSO) argues that any government-backed definition risks discriminating against other faiths and infringing on freedom of speech and religion. The NSO highlights historical and religious practices that could be deemed Islamophobic under existing definitions.

title: Shannon Sharpe’s alleged demand before meeting OnlyFans model sparks buzz
description: NFL legend Shannon Sharpe faced a lawsuit from an OnlyFans model accusing him of sexual assault and threats. Despite strongly denying the allegations, Sharpe reportedly paid the model $20 million. The lawsuit detailed a "rocky consensual relationship" and Sharpe's alleged failure to respect a "no."

description: Meeting comes amid infighting among trustees over board appointments and governance issues

title: Mark Carney praises Donald Trump for India - Pakistan ceasefire
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney lauded US President Donald Trump as transformative. Carney cited economic progress and Nato defense increases. He also suggested Trump eased India-Pakistan tensions. India however rejects this, stating the ceasefire followed direct military talks. The conflict began after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir. India launched Operation Sindoor in response.

description: A truck carrying LPG cylinders collided with another vehicle on the Jaipur-Ajmer highway near Dudu, triggering multiple explosions and a major fire. Police and fire brigades responded, halting traffic and commencing rescue operations. The fire has since been brought under control with no reported casualties.

title: Gabrielle Union recalls emotional toll of surrogacy, says she saw her bump as ‘failure
description: Gabrielle Union and Dwyane Wade faced significant struggles with infertility and miscarriages before opting for surrogacy. Despite these challenges, the couple has built a beautiful life raising their daughter, Kaavia.

Natural remedies lack scientific backing for vision correction, and cataract surgery is best done when vision is impacted, not when the cataract is 'ripe'.  Prioritize regular check-ups for optimal eye care.

The plan includes a ceasefire, Hamas disarmament, and Israeli withdrawal.

title: Gold rush! Despite record prices, central banks add it to forex portfolio

title: 44% drop: How number of Indian students going to US has declined
description: Student arrivals from India fell 44 percent, the sharpest fall among all major source countries. Overall international student arrivals to the US dropped 19 percent, indicating that the fall among Indians is far steeper than the global average. The downturn follows a smaller decline last year, showing a continuing trend rather than a one-time disruption.

title: From Gmail to Zoho: Email switch made easy; guide for effortless migration
description: Zoho Mail is emerging as a popular privacy-focused alternative to Gmail, especially for professionals and small businesses. The service offers custom domain support, an ad-free interface, and enhanced privacy. This guide outlines a simple process to migrate your emails, folders, and contacts from Gmail to Zoho Mail, ensuring no data loss.

title: Kim Pegula net worth 2025: How the Buffalo Bills owner built her NFL fortune
description: From an abandoned child in South Korea to a sports mogul, Kim Pegula's journey is remarkable. Alongside her husband Terry, she co-owns a $8 billion empire, including the Buffalo Bills and Sabres. Despite a serious health scare in 2022, Kim remains a powerful force in American sports, embodying resilience and leadership.
